page.title: 10FUNGI & FLOWERS IN POLWARTH
page.content: IN GOOD YEARS MUSHROOMS ARE PLENTIFUL & CHANTERELLES CAN BE FOUND IN SOME WOODS, BOTH EDIBLE. LESS ATTRACTIVE ARE FLY AGARIC (POISONOUS, DANGEROUS THOUGH RARLEY FATAL) OR GANODERMA APPLANATUM OR PALE MAUVE LACCARIA AMETHYSTINA, THIS LAST IS EDIBLE AS IS COPRINUS COMATUS (SHAGGY CAP). WILD FLOWERS ARE NUMEROUS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR EXCEPT IN THE DEAD OF WINTER, CELANDINES BEING FIRST OF THE WILD FLOWERS TO APPEAR. PRIMROSES, WOOD SORREL, GOLDEN SAXIFRAGE FOR SPRING; PURPLE CRANESBILL & MEADOWSWEET FOR SUMMER; HEARTSEASE FOR AUTUMN, THESE ARE BUT A FEW REPRESENTITIVES. FOX & CUBS & GRASS OF PARNASSUS, BOTH QUITE RARE FLOWERS, HAVE ALSO BEEN FOUND. THE DAFFODILS IN FRONT OF MARCHMONT & THE SNOWDROPS NOW EVERYWHERE WERE BOTH INTRODUCED.
